Replies.Reply: My check engine light came on, then it just started smoking, and ticking and shit.
Great. This the only show in town?
Just go ahead and fix it.
One of you guys mind pickin' us up a bottle of something?
I don't know. Vodka, whiskey, whatever.
Yeah, I think we'll just head back.
It's gonna take a couple days.
To Middlesex, Virginia? Do you have any clue how far that is?
We're not goin' back. Even El Reno's better than there.
How much money do we have left?
I can't believe your fucking parents wouldn't give you anything.
We should've waited till the end of the month when my mom gets her check.
I know where she keeps her cash.
Doesn't matter. As soon as we get to Vegas, we'll be set. My cousin said sometimes she makes two grand in a week.
Whoop-dee-doo. What the hell are you gonna do with a friggin' meteor?
Not much... just getting stared down by creepy priest boy back there.
You guys gotta come visit the club when we get all set up. We'll give you the VIP treatment, man...
Give us a little time, me and Sam'll be runnin' that place, no doubt... right?
I crashed at Randy's. We just got food. Want a burger?
Don't worry about it so much.
Just go ahead. I'll catch up with you later on.
Lemme guess, you wanna go home.
You wanna run back to mommy and daddy and say sorry so they can put you through college. Well that's real big of you, Sam, but I don't have that option.
I'll go home and get the shit kicked out of me, and get my ass grabbed by my mom's boyfriend...
I knew you'd bail on me eventually, but not this quick.
You can fucking sleepwalk back to Middlesex for all I care. I'm not driving you... you're a fucking drag.
Can't you just look up the license plates?
He was on the side of the road right before the accident.
I said some pretty shitty things to her right before it happened.
I need some cigarettes... and maybe some food. But I don't really have any money right now.
There's nothing for me to go home to. Trust me.
What's the point? She's gone, that's it. Nothing's gonna change that...
Is there a library around here?
When I moved to Virginia Sam was like the only person I could even stand to talk to.
place for too long, ya know?
I was really surprised when Sam wanted to come, actually. I just kinda brought it up one day, and she was down...
If it wasn't for me, she'd still be alive right now.
Sam said once she wished it landed on her room instead of Donnie's.
She told me it was from some accident. Put her hand through a window or something.
They still never found a driver to that car that hit Randy... I was standing right there. I didn't see anyone.

I found this book in Sam's backpack last night. There's a chapter where it talks about stuff like this happening. Like a guy being killed by an arrow that nobody shot, and a swordsmith getting killed by a sword he hadn't made yet.
Last night, and right before the accident, I saw...
You already think I'm a freak show.
I mean, there's nothing Randy could've done.
I need a new engine now?
I don't have anywhere near that much money.
I don't have that much either.
You wouldn't give me stuff and drive me around if you didn't want something in return.
Oh, it's just... something of Sam's.
Seems like you guys are pretty close.
Do you ever have a hard time telling what's real and what's not real?
I've got so much shit in my head right now... I've never felt so outta control. I think I'm really goin' psycho.
The things that feel the most real right now are... impossible. More like a dream.
What if the change is for the better?
I don't think I even care if I'm crazy.
What am I supposed to do?
I'm not crazy. I think everything's gonna be okay.
I understand... I just wanted to say that I'm sorry about everything that happened to Billy. And I know it doesn't seem like it, but everything happens for a reason...
I crashed at Randy's. We just got food. Want a burger?
Don't worry about it so much.
I said, I. Don't. Give. A. Fuck...
I'm tired of listening to you whine about everything.
It's gonna take a couple days.
Things get a little tough, you're just gonna give up?
Fuck that. I'll wait for my car and stick to the plan. Do whatever the fuck you want.
Thanks for stopping. Our car's messed up.
We're on the way to Vegas.
They totally flipped out that I was even going. They weren't about to give me money for the big trip.
She wouldn't have given you anything.
I hate it there. It's like everyone knows everything about me, but I'm invisible at the same time. It's like the worst of both worlds.
They didn't want me to leave...
That's why I love Corey, she just doesn't give a shit. She does what she wants and she doesn't care what people think.
I always thought I'd be a dancer, like in a troupe or something...
When I was younger, my dance team was on Star Search.
I didn't end up dancing in the talent show where they got discovered... I didn't really feel like it at the time anyway.
But that's why we're going to Vegas. There's lots of opportunities there.
Is that supposed to be like some kind of judgement or something?
Uh... I, I don't know yet.
I've just gotta find Corey... and check on the car.
Are you able to get money wired here from my bank back home?
I need to check my balance and get my money out. How do I do that?
Trying to get money... not very successfully.
What happened to me...? Where the hell've you been?
We gotta talk about what we're gonna do.
The motel guy came to the room this morning all pissed off. We're probably not even gonna have enough money to pay for the car.
We just gotta figure out what we're gonna do. I don't think-
What happened to me...? Where the hell've you been?
We gotta talk about what we're gonna do.
Corey, you're still drunk. Don't be a fuck-ass.
What the fuck are you talking about?

I know what you meant, and it's bullshit. When someone dies for no reason you can't just make one up to fill the void and make yourself feel better. It sucks, and it fucks everything up, but it doesn't mean shit beyond that.
Hi, Tom. I like your new mask.
I know you can hear me...
I think it's genetic or something.
It's just that my brother used to do it too.
Do you believe that everything happens for a reason?
Yeah... I learned that in science.
Yeah, but do you believe that everything happens for a reason, like in life?
You wanna know what happens when you die?
I was just upset. I shouldn't have snapped at you like that.
I'm gonna be taking off soon, I think. I just gotta figure some stuff out. It's quiet here.
I was just on my way out. What were you gonna say?
Okay, well... I'll see you later?
What if it's like... proof of some alien life-form from another galaxy or something.
There's this book I think you'd like... I got it from my physics teacher in high school.
It's called The Philosophy of Time Travel.
Yeah, but it's not really that.
My life seems to be full of them.
And nobody really calls my Samantha. Just my mom and dad.
Hey, you could've been some crazy rapist serial killer.
I can take care of myself.
What makes you think you can tell me who I can and can't hang around with?
He was just a kid, he didn't know what he was doing.
Chris... you're a nice guy, but you don't have to be looking out for me. You're not my dad, you're not my big brother...
They're lucky to have someone to protect them.
No... I've been around. Going for lots of walks.
Like I said, I've been in and out.
I kind of... gave it to someone.
You didn't have to do that.
Same reason you talk to me...
Because I can see how special you are.
They will. Only one day left.
Chris, but... he's stuck at work.
Gimme a sec. Lemme grab my sweatshirt...
Shouldn't we go back out there where we can see?
No... I just think you should get it looked at-
What the hell are you doing?
It's not like that... You should come too.
It's alright. She can take care of herself... she's good at it. I've gotta go home.
Blew your water pump. Can't drive it.
El Reno's just a couple miles up ahead. Can call for a tow there.
He waves to everybody... Just kinda walks up and down.
He thinks he was... kind of a joke, ya know?
So you guys stayed here last night?
I was just gonna say, if you wanted, I could give you a ride back.
You too. I mean, I could give you both a ride.
Thought you could maybe use this.
So what's so wrong at home that you had to take off?
I'd love to get outta here someday too... just don't know quite where I'd go.
You just gotta be yourself, that's all. What is it you wanna do exactly?
Yeah, good place for it. Gettin' some practice on the way, too.
Should know better than to be carrying his rifle around town like that...
I had to put in a statement too.
It's such a waste. Just a horrible, freak thing.
I'm sure she knew you didn't mean it.
Is there anything I can do?
So you guys were real close, huh.
How long had you been plannin' your trip together?
Her parents must be going through hell.
I saw something on Sam's wrist the other night... it looked like a scar.
I don't understand why we're lookin' at this stuff.
I was pretty close too, but everything was all crazy. Whoever it was must've jumped out and took off.
A book...? I don't get what your talkin' about. What was the reason?
He should be. He was driving around shit-faced and somebody got killed.
That's probably as much as the car's worth.
You didn't do anything. What's she want a water pump for if she doesn't have an engine?
They're there. At the front, by the Trapper Keepers.
They found that Billy Moorcroft kid. He was at Dusty's house...
Sick bastard had him locked up in the basement. I can't believe we were just over there yesterday.
I guess he's gonna be okay-
It's horrible... but sometimes these things can happen for a reason. Sometimes good can come of it... growth, ya know?
I just stopped by to see how you were holdin' up.
Sorry about the other night... I DIDN'T-
So what are you still doin' here? I figured you woulda hopped on a bus by now.
I don't know if you're doin' anything later on, but...
It's so messed up... I feel bad that I recommended him now.
I'm sure you can... but I wouldn't feel right if I didn't tell you about Jeremy.
I don't know what you have goin' with him... but you shouldn't be hangin' around him. Let's just leave it at that.
It's just that I know him better than you do. He lived in my neighborhood when we were kids.
So he used to do weird stuff... to animals.

My sister lost her pet rabbit once, and we went all over the neighborhood lookin' for it. We were just about to call it quits when we heard something comin' from Jeremy's garage. He'd stuck it in a trash can and put the lid on.
It was half starved by the time we got it home. Died just a few days later.
I don't know, just a couple years.
When you were nine years old did you know it was wrong to put a living creature in the trash can and leave it there?
It is, actually. You're disturbing my customers. Get out.
So you guys stayed here last night?
It's none of my business, but...
I was just gonna say, if you wanted, I could give you a ride back.
You too. I mean, I could give you both a ride.
Sorry to screw you guys up.
You get checked into the motel alright?
Your obviously just passin' through here.
Well... you need anything besides booze, you just lemme know.
I think that asshole knows I deal.
Come to check on your car?
Randy's been a wreck since the accident.
Prima donna motherfucker think your shit don't stink?
I can order you up a new one.
Cheapest and the best. But you want me to call the tow guy back here, no problem. Probably charge you another hundred bucks, but he'll get ya wherever you wanna go.
Got some bad news for you...
Your engine seized up when your water pump blew.
I can get one in there for you.
I understand. But, I already ordered the water pump, and I'll have to get paid for my time. That comes to about three-hundred total.
You think I do this for charity?
I see how it is... couple a' punks.
What can I do for you?
I saw him out in front of the motel early this morning, alive and well.
You plannin' on checkin' out today?
Well, it's already way past checkout time, so you'd better figure it out quick.
You do whatever you have to, but if you're stayin' another night I wanna see some money up front.
Go back to your room and get some sleep. You've had a tough day.
My name's Randy. This is Mike and Jeff. Guess you already know Ruth.
I think I can manage that. What do you want?
No problem. You guys wanna come back to my place for bit? Bring your bottle, we got some weed...
I'm throwin' a big party at my house tonight, you guys should come by. No excuses this time...
You're gonna be stuck in El Reno, you might as well have some fun, right?
Don't worry about Ryan. He might be a cop, but he still likes to party.
From what I hear he's got a little somethin' goin' on the side himself.
We might as well all go in now, we're already wet.
You think it's my fault she's dead.
You wanna get outta here for a while? I got my dad's car.
I've been comin' up here since I was a kid. Good place when you wanna just get away from everything.
Naw, we're just friends. She's pretty weird sometimes. Too like...
Sometimes... sometimes something can feel really real, but it's just your mind playing tricks on you.

I got some acid from my buddy one time... this like flying eagle pyramid shit. I took two hits, and man... next thing I knew I was on the floor, curled up in ball, and Mike and Jeff were just standing there lookin' down at me. I could see this like glowing grid cutting through my brain, and I knew when it got all the way through I'd be this sketched out vegetable. I could picture my dad staring down at me in the hospital in my straightjacket, crying and shit...
The whole time my esophagus was like twisting and turning in my throat and cutting off my air supply... it was terrible.
I can still slip back into it sometimes, but I know now that my brain is what's making it real...
I know what you mean. The scariest part is thinking you're not the same person anymore. Something's changed... like your identity.
15 days... 18 hours... 45 minutes... 6 seconds. That is when the world will end.
We got some kinda situation at Frank Haley's farm...
You know how much it's gonna cost me to replace this goddamn windmill?
That whack job Tom's been squattin' up there the last couple a' months.
Do I look like the type of guy that's gonna try and profit off another man's death? You should be ashamed of yourself.
I don't believe it... I still just don't believe it.

Replies.Didascalie: (dabbing at her eyes with a tissue)

Replies.Reply: No, it's not... Mount Calvary burned to the ground last night.
The police are looking into it, but... I know it was arson.
It's no secret to me how people in this town feel about Father Homeijer. The horrible accusations that have been made against him...
But with all the drugs and the crime... I just don't know what this world's coming to anymore.
We don't usually work with other banks like that.
You'll have to call and arrange it.
We're taking collections to help rebuild Mount Calvary after the tragic fire.
I never had any doubts in you, or in the Lord.
One more glass won't hurt you. You deserve it, Father...
I see the way you look at me, Father...
I can't do this. I'm a man of the cloth... and you'd regret it.
I feel like such an idiot...
Here you go. Where'd you two say you were from again?
Anything else you need, give a holler.
No matter how well you think you know somebody, you just never really know...
Dusty Gibbens has been comin' in here for coffee ever since I can remember... gives me the shivers.
I'll be right back with your breakfast.
What can I get you, honey?
I'll be damned. I'm from Reedville, if you know where abouts that is...
Well, have yourself some ice cream when you're done, on the house.
They should hang guys like that.
No, no... it's just that I recognize you. I saw you by the motel. Pretty amazing, huh?
I just made a deal with Frank Haley to buy it for seven-hundred fifty dollars.
I'm gonna study it. I'm a grad student at Redlands... we've actually got a pretty cool geology lab there.
I've gotta do some tests, but if I had to guess, I'd say it's a siderite. They're composed primarily of iron and nickel.
I didn't get your name at the diner.
So what are you up to?
I've gotta pick up some cash too.
I could let you borrow some money... if you need some.
You're sure you don't want to check out the lab?
Sam? Are you okay? What are doing?
You shouldn't be out here like this. C'mon, get in.
That's interesting... I've never heard of a specific genetic marker for sleepwalking.
I think it's more common in children. When did your brother stop?
I wasn't gonna say anything... but then I thought I probably should, because if I didn't, it might be inconsiderate.
So... what are you gonna do?
I know that for every action there's an equal and opposite reaction.
And everything in the universe is in constant motion, as the universe is constantly expanding...
I think everyone has a purpose.
I'm making amazing discoveries every day, practically sleeping at the lab...
I know you need it. It's no big deal.
The rest is locked away somewhere else... somewhere safe. Everyone's gonna want a piece of this thing pretty soon.
You ever seen one of these?
It's a scanning electron microscope. It uses electrons instead of light to scan the image.
At first I thought it was a siderite, but then I saw it was more than that. Much more. It does have a percentage of nickel and iron in it as I first suspected.
An unrecognizable element. I've done all the tests. It doesn't exist on the periodic table.
This is history. I'm thinking of calling it framium.

It's very important you promise me you won't tell anyone else what I've showed you. I have to wait till just the right moment. NASA, or some secret government organization could come in here and take it away from me...
And then later on, years from now, take credit for the discovery themselves.
The study of physics has unraveled some of the most profound mysteries of the universe.
Mysteries are what make life interesting...
You're a mystery to me, Samantha.
I'm sorry. I should've know better.
Nothing... just that I haven't see you around for the past few days. I was worried. I thought you might've taken off.
Well, there's something I wanted to ask you. You know that book you mentioned?
I'd really love to check it out.
You said you'd show it to me sometime, and I've got a hunch it could really help me in some of my studies related to-
Vietnam Tom!? You gave away the book to Vietnam Tom!?
I don't fucking believe what you're telling me!
He's a fucking bum! And you chose him over me!?
This is none of your business.
I hope you can forgive the way I acted.
I've been so wrapped up with the meteorite. I haven't been eating or sleeping much. I think I'm just drained... but that's no excuse.
I was wondering if you'd let me make it up to you.
Please... let me take you to watch the fireworks tonight.
It's gonna be spectacular. There's gonna be a meteor shower that coincides with the show... I mean, how often does that happen?
I just wanna be your friend.
So, what do you say? Will you go with me?
No, this'll be perfect. See right there?
That's right where the fireworks'll come up.
And we can see the meteors better without all the lights from the town.
You need to get that covered...
I barely even notice it anymore.
So you do find me disgusting. Which is it, Sam, I can't take much more of this shit!
I just wanna talk to you!
I don't know... I don't know...
Did she just call her a fuck-ass?
Don't worry, you're a little old for his taste.
How many cheeseburgers did we get?
It's gonna be alright. You'll see.
They're made of silver-plated steel. A simple fire couldn't do that.
This is an extension of Satan's own hand... I've seen it coming.
Any small amount you could manage would really help.
Any small amount you could manage would really help.
You take this street, I'll take that one?
Dusty? I'd like to trouble you for a small donation...

I was out collecting donations in order to help rebuild my church, Mount Calvary, which recently burned down. Clearly the Lord works in mysterious ways. This is nothing less than divine intervention...
I know that. And we both truly appreciate all your faith and hard work...
We needed a miracle, but we got two instead.
Sam is walking in front of a DEPARTMENT STORE when Randy's car pulls up beside her. Corey sticks her head out the passenger side window.
Sam is walking in front of the department store when Randy's car pulls up beside her. Corey sticks her head out the passenger side window.
You need to save me, Corey.
You need to save me... and save the world.
If you tell them about me they'll think you're a dummy.
I didn't pick you. Just like you didn't pick me either.
We shouldn't even be here. Nobody should...
-- WATER POURS out from under the garage door down to the street. PULL BACK TO REVEAL --
The place for Billy to be right now is at home with his family...
It'll take years for him to work through what happened, but the best way to open those doors is to surround him with things that are familiar...
The Last Unicorn, by Samantha Darko!
There was once a unicorn named Ariel...
It's not wrinkled Sam. Just, ya know, flatten it in a book or something...
Is that you?... if it's you, please come home.

We have an update this morning on our breaking news of Billy Moorcroft, the El Reno youth who was kidnapped over 15 months ago, and rescued yesterday afternoon by Father Homeijer of Mount Calvary Church. Billy's condition at this time is considered stable...
Father, what led you to this particular house on this particular day?
I saw you snatch the drugs outta that house.
I don't wanna turn you in.
How much you think you'll get when you unload it?
I'll take forty percent this time, but from now on it's fifty-fifty.
I got a pretty good idea this ain't the first time you done this. Won't be the last, will it?
My mom told me someday everybody would understand. She said it was my job to look out for the town...
They don't know why. They don't even want me here, but I still have to protect them.
I'm used to it... I'm lucky to have a job to do. Some people don't have any reason to be here at all.
You're more important than all of us.
Why do you talk to me?
